comment._content: Felix Isman was a vaudeville impresario and later a pioneer in motion picture exhibition. He was also an author and a real estate developer. He was a partner of the vaudeville team Weber and Fields in the Broadway Theatre in New York, acting as their producer. In 1924, his book "Weber and Fields : Their Tribulations, Triumphs and Their Associates" was published. A 1914 volume, "The Theatre of Science: A Volume of Progress and Achievement in the Motion Picture Industry" by Robert Grau, has a brief section on Isman, beginning on page 299. A PDF of the book is available from Google Books here, or find the Felix Isman references in it by using the "Search in this book" box about midway down that page.
